availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William E. Cox (Franklin Co, KY clerk, Ky National Legion, aide-de-camp & 1st lieut)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Austin P. Cox and Mary P. Cox. Resident of Franklin County in 1850. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Resident of Franklin County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. Clerk in Franklin County in 1863. Appointed aide-de-camp and first lieutenant for the Kentucky National Legion on March 13, 1865. Clerk for Daniel W. Lindsey in the offices of the Inspector General and Adjutant General in 1865.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 907 (p. 16 of 19 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort District 1, p. 492A..
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 7th Congressional District, Franklin County, Vol. 1 of 2, July 1863, p. 5, p. 224 of 370 of microfilm), (Accessed via ancestry.com on November 6, 2020).
